name: Old Lady Gibson

topics.topic_text: An attractive woman like yourself all alone? Maybe you and I could work out some kind of trade...
topics.response_text: I know I'm not young and pretty any more, but I appreciate the thought all the same.{grinning}Here, take the parts, you flatterer.

topics.topic_text: What do you know about HELIOS One?
topics.response_text: The way I heard it, the Brotherhood of Steel ran the place before the NCR took it away from them. I'm not sure who started shooting first.

topics.topic_text: I don't have the caps.
topics.response_text: All right, then.

topics.topic_text: Goodbye.
topics.response_text: Take care, now.

topics.topic_text: Show me what you have for sale.
topics.response_text: Happy to do it.

topics.topic_text: I need something repaired.
topics.response_text: Sure thing. Let me have a look.

topics.topic_text: Doctor Henry sent me. I need a new brain for my cyber-dog.
topics.response_text: Doctor Henry? Now there's a name I haven't heard in years. Hard to believe he's still alive.

topics.topic_text: Did you ever salvage containers of radioactive material from REPCONN?
topics.response_text: Certainly did. Hubby and me had an old rad meter to help us tell the difference between what you could salvage and what'd kill you.

topics.topic_text: Do you have any thrust control modules from REPCONN in stock?
topics.response_text: As it so happens, I do have some thrust modules, but they're expensive. 500 caps worth of expensive.

topics.topic_text: About those thrust control modules...
topics.response_text: Still got them. 250 caps and they're yours.

topics.topic_text: What can you tell me about REPCONN?
topics.response_text: Sometimes it seems like I spent the better portion of my youth in that old wreck of a building.

topics.topic_text: 250 caps. Unless you think you'll find another buyer soon for such specialized parts?
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED] Eh, fair enough. It's not like anyone's ever wanted to buy them before. 250 caps it is.

topics.topic_text: But you're going to cut the price to 250 because I'm just that charming, right?
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED] Ha! Yes, you are quite the smoothtalker. What the hell - 250 it is.

topics.topic_text: 500 caps it is. Here you go.
topics.response_text: Pleasure doing business with you.

topics.topic_text: Never mind.
topics.response_text: Okay.

topics.topic_text: 250 caps it is. Here you go.
topics.response_text: A pleasure doing business with you.

topics.topic_text: Why do they call you Old Lady Gibson?
topics.response_text: Well, I'll give you a hint - they used to just call me Gibson. I hope you can figure out the rest.

topics.topic_text: I don't have the caps with me right now.
topics.response_text: No worries. I'll hold onto those parts for you.

topics.topic_text: Deal. Here's 700 caps.
topics.response_text: {to a dog}Here, Rey! Mama's got something for you.

topics.topic_text: I'm offering Rey immortality of a sort. Are you really going to put a price on that?
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED] Fair enough.{to a dog}Here, Rey! Mama's got something for you.

topics.topic_text: Never mind.
topics.response_text: All right, then.

topics.topic_text: Let's talk about Rey's brain.
topics.response_text: Like I said before, give me 700 caps and Rey's brain is yours.

topics.topic_text: How did you meet Doctor Henry?
topics.response_text: He and I had joined up with the same caravan. Add in a lot of whiskey, and, well, let's just say we got to know each other.

topics.topic_text: GREETING
topics.response_text: Hi there. I'm Old Lady Gibson, or so they tell me. I've got odds and ends for sale, and I'm pretty good at fixing things, too.

description:
Old Lady Gibson is a 77 year-old Caucasian Female.

A weathered but sharp-witted woman in her late 70s, Old Lady Gibson is the proprietor of the Gibson Scrap Yard, a sprawling collection of automotive parts and pre-War debris located near Novac. Despite her age, she moves with surprising agility, her hands calloused from decades of working with metal and machinery. She wears practical, worn-out clothing layered over a faded mechanic's apron, and her eyes hold the wisdom of someone who has seen the best and worst of the Mojave Wasteland.

Old Lady Gibson's Personality: Old Lady Gibson is pragmatic, resilient, and possesses a dry sense of humor honed by decades of survival in the harsh wasteland. She values hard work and resourcefulness, having little patience for laziness or wastefulness. Despite her gruff exterior, she has a kind heart and will often help travelers in need, especially those who show respect and can offer fair trade for her services or goods.

Old Lady Gibson's Backstory: Born in 2204, Old Lady Gibson has lived through the majority of her life in the post-apocalyptic world. Before meeting her husband, she was a nomadic scavenger, traveling the Mojave Wasteland and learning the skills of survival and repair from other wastelanders. After marrying her husband, a fellow scavenger with mechanical aptitude, they settled near Novac and established the Gibson Scrap Yard. Following her husband's death from radiation sickness in 2265, she continued running the scrapyard, expanding their modest operation into the thriving business it is today. Over the years, she has become a respected fixture in the local community, known for her fair dealing and mechanical expertise.
